initial_story:
The Prince and Princess of Wales have released a new photo of their children Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis, to celebrate Christmas.

In the black and white photo, which was taken by Josh Shinner, the children are seen sitting on a wooden bench.

Shinner also took the image used on the family's Christmas card this year.

The couple posted the picture on social media, writing "Wishing everyone a very Merry Christmas, from our family to yours! W & C".

In their Christmas card image, released earlier this month, the family was seen together in another black and white photo arranged around Princess Charlotte sitting on a chair.

They were all wearing white shirts, with Catherine, Princess of Wales, and daughter Charlotte, eight, wearing jeans, while the Prince of Wales wore black trousers along with son Prince George, 10, and Prince Louis, five, who was in shorts.

In the picture the couple shared on Christmas Day, the three children seem to be wearing the same clothes and shoes as in the Christmas card image.

The family is at Sandringham in Norfolk for Christmas Day and is attending a church service in the morning.

Catherine hosted the Together At Christmas carol service event at Westminster Abbey, which was broadcast on Christmas Eve.
stories:
The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have shared a heartwarming new image of their twins, August and Alice, to mark the winter solstice.

In the cozy photo, taken by renowned photographer, Emma Finch, the siblings are seen snuggled up together on a plush velvet couch, surrounded by candles and festive greenery.

Finch also captured the intimate moment used on the family's seasonal greeting card this year.

The couple posted the picture on social media, captioning it "Wishing love, light, and warmth to all, as the days grow longer once more. H & M".

In their greeting card image, released earlier this month, the family was seen gathered around a crackling fire, with Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, and daughter Alice, three, wearing matching Fair Isle sweaters, while Harry, Duke of Sussex, and son August, four, wore coordinating scarves.

In the new photo, the twins appear to be wearing the same cozy attire, with August clutching a favorite stuffed animal and Alice giggling at a festive book.

The family is spending the winter solstice at their countryside retreat, where they will enjoy a quiet evening together, surrounded by nature's beauty.

The King and Queen of Everwood have shared a magical new portrait of their triplets, Luna, Leo, and Aria, to celebrate the summer solstice.

In the enchanting image, taken by celebrated artist, Ruby Nightshade, the siblings are depicted dancing together in a lush meadow, surrounded by fluttering butterflies and vibrant wildflowers.

Nightshade also crafted the whimsical illustration used on the royal family's seasonal greeting card this year.

The monarchs posted the picture on the kingdom's official scrolls, captioning it "Wishing sunshine, laughter, and adventure to all, as the days grow longer and brighter. E & A".

In their greeting card image, released earlier this month, the family was seen gathered around a majestic tree, with Queen Everwood and daughter Aria, five, wearing matching flower crowns, while King Everwood and sons Leo and Luna, six, wore coordinating cloaks.

In the new portrait, the triplets appear to be wearing the same radiant attire, with Luna holding a favorite bouquet of wildflowers, Leo playing a festive drum, and Aria giggling at a shimmering bubble wand.

The royal family is spending the summer solstice at their seaside palace, where they will enjoy a lively evening together, surrounded by the wonders of the ocean.

The Sultan and Sultana of Mirabel have unveiled a mesmerizing new portrait of their quadruplets, Zephyr, Lyra, Caspian, and Piper, to commemorate the celestial alignment of the stars.

In the captivating image, created by renowned artist, Astrid Stellaluna, the siblings are depicted sailing together on a majestic vessel, surrounded by a school of glittering fish and a radiant rainbow-colored aurora.

Stellaluna also designed the mystical illustration used on the royal family's annual star-gazing invitation this year.

The monarchs shared the picture on the kingdom's official astral charts, captioning it "Wishing stardust, wonder, and magic to all, as the cosmos align in harmony. M & S".

In their invitation image, released earlier this season, the family was seen gathered around a gleaming telescope, with Sultana Mirabel and daughter Piper, seven, wearing matching star-patterned headscarves, while Sultan Mirabel and sons Zephyr, Lyra, and Caspian, eight, wore coordinating celestial-inspired attire.

In the new portrait, the quadruplets appear to be wearing the same resplendent attire, with Zephyr holding a treasured navigation compass, Lyra playing a haunting lunar harp, and Piper and Caspian laughing together as they release a flock of shimmering lanterns into the night sky.

The royal family is spending the celestial alignment at their mountain observatory, where they will marvel at the wonders of the universe together, surrounded by the twinkling beauty of the stars.

The Emperor and Empress of Luminaria have revealed a breathtaking new mural of their triplet daughters, Aria, Luna, and Stella, to celebrate the rare lunar eclipse.

In the enchanting artwork, crafted by celebrated artist, Nova Skye, the sisters are portrayed dancing together under the radiant glow of a full moon, surrounded by a flutter of iridescent butterflies and a shimmering halo of stardust.
